intro: Trichomanes acuto-obtusum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, slender fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant has a unique growth habit, often forming dense, mat-like colonies on moist, shaded rock surfaces. Its leaves are usually bipinnate, with small, rounded pinnae that are arranged in a compact, overlapping pattern. Trichomanes acuto-obtusum is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
